name: Kepler-331
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-331 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-331 is a star with 0.38999999999999974 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.49 times its radius. It is located 1923.11 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-331 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-331 b

Kepler-331 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 8.46 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-331.

The mass of Kepler-331 b is 4.03 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-331 b is 1.82 that of Earth. At 4.03 Earth masses, Kepler-331 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-331 c

Kepler-331 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 17.28 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-331.

The mass of Kepler-331 c is 4.15 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-331 c is 1.84 that of Earth. At 4.15 Earth masses, Kepler-331 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-331 d

Kepler-331 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.16 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 32.13 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-331.

The mass of Kepler-331 d is 3.14 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-331 d is 1.64 that of Earth. At 3.14 Earth masses, Kepler-331 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

With a semi-major axis of 0.159 astronomical units, and a mass of 3.14 Earth masses, Kepler-331 d could, potentially, be a habitable planet with stable bodies of liquid water on its surface, like Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-331, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
